com.example.mfind.timetracker

Class FileManipulationsPersistentData

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • com.example.mfind.timetracker.FileManipulationsPersistentData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class FileManipulationsPersistentData
extends android.app.Service
    This class is used by MainActivity and BroadcastReceiver Service to get some values or update files in application persistent data proto. It's the only way of communicating with the actual class that does the operations on persistent data proto

      • deleteExcessDays

        private com.example.mfind.timetracker.TimeProto.TimeData.Builder deleteExcessDays(com.example.mfind.timetracker.TimeProto.TimeData.Builder wifiData)
        Removes excess days - days above 91 are NOT required to calculate averages
        Parameters:
        wifiData - - Builder consisting of all days, with possibly some excess days
        Returns:
        - returns Builder without excess days

      • findIndexByDate

        public int findIndexByDate(int year,
                           int month,
                           int day)
        Finds index of a day by a days: year value, month value and day value
        Parameters:
        year - - year value of the day you are looking for
        month - - month value of the day you are looking for
        day - - day value of the day you are looking for
        Returns:
        - returns index that should be used fast - in case of doing this close to midnight value might become inaccurate quite fast

      • inSeconds

        public static int inSeconds(com.example.mfind.timetracker.TimeProto.Day day)
        Calculates number of seconds from all of the edits from a given Day
        Parameters:
        day - - Day to calculate sum of ticker edits on
        Returns:
        - returns number of seconds

      • invalidateInitialization

        public void invalidateInitialization()
        invalidates already calculated values, so the next time someone asks for values we actively need to refresh them. This allows to later return true values while at the same time minimizing number of times that the calculation have to be done

      • onBind

        public android.os.IBinder onBind(android.content.Intent intent)
        when someone is binding to this class, we return out binder - our ~interface~ to talk with us
        Specified by:
        onBind in class android.app.Service
        Parameters:
        intent - - specified intent of the class that wants to bind to us, we could read this intent and decide based on that if we actually want to give caller a binder or not
        Returns:
        - returns a binder

      • prefillWithData

        private void prefillWithData()
        Used only when first launching the application Creates empty proto with 91 empty days in it

      • prependTicker

        int prependTicker(int secs)
        Used to add seconds to todays day, creating (prepending) it if needed (if day doesn't already exist)
        Parameters:
        secs - - number of seconds to prepend
        Returns:
        - returns today ticker

        Prepends wifiData with empty days - is makes calculating averages easier
        Parameters:
        wifiData - - data to prepend some days to
        Returns:
        - returns wifiData with prepended days
